720017f-b.text:
(1)
Gold Street(Foreground), west side, north from Platt (left), to John (right) Streets, showing the 25-story Ansumance Centre Building. Also shown (extreme left foreground) is demolition on the east side of the Street to make room for the 28-story office building, No. 90 John Street. In the center is visible a portion of the clearance at the S. W. corner William and John Streets, upon which was erected the 30-story New Amsterdam Casualty
Buildins.
July 8, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same at a later date, showing the steel skeleton of the New Amsterdam Casualty Building.
October 13, 1930.
P. L. Spemr.

722616f-a.text:
(1)
P1att Street, north side, east from and including Gold, to and including Pearl Street, and showing a general view eastward over the East River, to Brooklyn. A portion of the Brooklyn Bridge is shown on the left in the extreme background. Prominent building with stacks is occupied by the New York Steam Heating Co., and is located on Water Sgreet, at the S.W. corner of
Burling Slip.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from the Street level and showing a closer view of
the buildings.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. 3per.
(3)
The same, but at a later date, showing new building
completed.
April 19, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

722618f-b.text:
(1)
Platt Street, south side, at Gold Street, as seen through excavation on Platt Street, at the N.E. corner of Gold Street. Also shown is Gold Street, east side, south from and including
Platt, to and including Maiden Lane.
October 13, 1930.
.2E. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
October 13, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
722618f-b.folder: Platt Street & Gold Street, Manhattan, NY

722618f-a.folder: Platt Street & Gold Street, Manhattan, NY

722619f-a.text:
Platt Street (left) at Gold Street (right), as seen through an excavation at the N.E. corner of same and showing a 4 story structure, No. 15 Cold Street, that housed the firm of Thomas Prosser & Son for 92 years. This firm, founded in 1845 at this site, is the American Nrepresentative of the Krupp Steel Works of Germany. According to the New York Times of December 8, 1937, they will move to new cuarters at No. 120 Wall Street. Upon the clearance in the foreground stands a 28 story office building, known as No. 9O John Street. The building that partially appears on the right is a new structure and is the 25 story Insurance Centre Building, No. 80 John Street. The corner shown of the latter, is the former site of the " Jack Knife " building, No. 19 Gold Street; a triangular structure that remained from a former large building when Jacob Platt cut Platt Street through in 1834.
October 13, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, but with a different perspective, as seen from No. 111 John Street, located at the N.W. corner of Psarl Street. Note on the
left, Gold Street continuing southward to Maiden Lane.
722619f-a.folder: Platt Street & Gold Street, Manhattan, NY

722619f-b.folder: Platt Street & Gold Street, Manhattan, NY

722617f-c.text:
P1att Street, north side, est from Gold to William Streets, showing a trianmular building (No. 19 Gold Street) at the N.W. corner. The present structure is the remnant of a large building, part of which was demolished shen Jacob Platt cut Platt Street through in 1834. In the foreground appears the lower stories of No. 23 Platt Street,at the N.E. corner of Gold Street. Note the Woodbridge Building (N.E. corner of Willtam and Platt Streets) at the rear of the "Jack Knife" house. IIn 1930 this odd structure was demolished to form a portion of the present (1937) site of the Insurance Centre Building. For pictures of the latter see files for John or Gold Streets. Nos. 1 and 2 of this set of 4 views are similar; 3 and 4 being in the opposite (eastward) direction from the Mmiddle of the block. No. 4 also shows a more extensive view eastward on the north side of Platt Street, to Pearl Street where the stacks of the New York Steam Co. appears across the Pearl Street buildings.
Views 1 & 4: May 1924.
Views 2 & 3: July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
722617f-c.folder: Platt Street & Gold Street, Manhattan, NY
